Package ServerSide

Class NetworkServer

java.lang.Object
ServerSide.NetworkServer
class NetworkServer
extends java.lang.Object
The heart and soul of the server program. Inspired heavily by week 7 and 8 exercises. Listens for requests infinitely
Author:
Sophia Walsh Long

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) java.time.LocalDateTime lastReconciliation
    Time of last trade reconciliation
    (package private) java.util.Timer tradeReconciliation
    Timer (initialised in the ServerGUI thread)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    NetworkServer()
    Constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) static int getPort()
    Returns the port the server is configured to use
    (package private) void reconcileTrades()
    Do trade reconciliation.
    (package private) int resetEverything()
    Empty the database.
    (package private) void setupTables()
    Run all create table scripts
    (package private) void shutdown()
    Requests the server to shut down
    (package private) int simulateNonselect​(ProtocolKeywords keyword, DataPacket info)
    Non-private wrapper for testing INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE queries
    (package private) java.util.ArrayList<DataObject> simulateSelect​(DataPacket info)
    Non-private wrapper for testing SELECT queries

  • Field Details

    • tradeReconciliation

      java.util.Timer tradeReconciliation
      Timer (initialised in the ServerGUI thread)

    • lastReconciliation

      java.time.LocalDateTime lastReconciliation
      Time of last trade reconciliation

  • Constructor Details

    • NetworkServer

      NetworkServer()
      Constructor. Gets connection, sets up tables, prepares statements

  • Method Details

    • setupTables

      void setupTables() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Run all create table scripts
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if a SQL error occurred (shouldn't happen)

    • getPort

      static int getPort()
      Returns the port the server is configured to use
      Returns:
      The port number

    • start

      void start() throws java.io.IOException
      Starts the server running on the default port, code borrowed from week 7 exercise
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • shutdown

      void shutdown()
      Requests the server to shut down

    • reconcileTrades

      void reconcileTrades()
      Do trade reconciliation. Both the outer loop over sell orders and the inner loop over buy orders are conducted from oldest to newest. Feedback is printed to the console

    • simulateSelect

      java.util.ArrayList<DataObject> simulateSelect​(DataPacket info) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Non-private wrapper for testing SELECT queries
      Parameters:
      info - DataPacket of query
      Returns:
      ArrayList of results
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • simulateNonselect

      int simulateNonselect​(ProtocolKeywords keyword, DataPacket info) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Non-private wrapper for testing INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE queries
      Parameters:
      keyword - Query type
      info - DataPacket of query
      Returns:
      Query status number (1 for "success", 0 for "failure due to existence/nonexistence of matching record", -1 for "failure due to constraints", 2 for "INSERT ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE query didn't insert but updated")
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • resetEverything

      int resetEverything() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Empty the database. Only exists for test and debug convenience, may deprecate later due to unsafeness
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
